intro: Psychotria castellana, commonly known as the Castellana Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in countries like Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its dark green, oval-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. The plant is also noted for its medicinal properties, though it contains toxic alkaloids that require careful handling.
